result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miroslaw Pienkowski

Defendant Miroslaw Pienkowski not in court.  Defendant is in the hallway unable to appear by zoom. Attorney Richard Joseph Smith in court for Miroslaw Pienkowski.  Attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Polish interpreter's appearance is waived for today hearing.  
Case is adjourned to 11-9-22 at 8:30 am for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Miroslaw Pienkowski in court with attorney Richard Joseph Smith.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Joanna Garber.
Case in court for a status conference. Due to the nature of the offense, this case is re-tabbed to Br. 10. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Miroslaw Pienkowski in court with attorney Richard Joseph Smith.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Sworn as Interpreter:  Krystyna Eiden.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Smith has received and reviewed discovery.  Atty. Smith is negotiating for a DPA and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Miroslaw Pienkowski in court with attorney Jade K Hall. Defendant Miroslaw Pienkowski in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Miroslaw Pienkowski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
